revision.text:
{{expand language|topic=|langcode=ro|otherarticle=Bătălia de la Giurgiu|date=February 2013}} {{Infobox military conflict |conflict=Battle of Giurgiu |partof=the [[Long War (Ottoman wars)]] |image = Batalia de la Giurgiu.jpg |image_size = 200 |caption = The battle as depicted by [[Theodor Aman]] |date= 27–30 October 1595 |place=[[Giurgiu]] |result=Christian victory |combatant1= [[Image:Coat of arms of Transylvania.svg|20px]] [[Principality of Transylvania (1571–1711)|Transylvania]]
{{flagicon|Wallachia}} [[Wallachia]]
{{flagdeco|Moldavia}} [[Moldavia]]
{{flagicon|Holy Roman Empire}} [[Holy Roman Empire]] |combatant2=[[File:Flag of the Ottoman Empire (1453-1844).svg|25px]] [[Ottoman Empire]] |commander1=[[Stephen Bocskay]]
[[Mihai Viteazul|Michael the Brave]] |commander2=[[Sinan Pasha]] |strength1=50,000-51,000{{cn|date=August 2016}} * 37,000-38,000 Transylvanians (22,000-23,000 [[Székelys]], and 15,000 soldiers sent by the counties and towns){{cite web|url=http://mek.niif.hu/03400/03407/html/118.html|title=Zsigmond Báthori, Michael the Brave, and Giorgio Basta|publisher=mek.niif.hu|accessdate=2014-11-26}}{{cite book |last1=Pop |first1=Ioan-Aurel |last2=Bolovan |first2=Ioan |year=2006 |title=History of Romania: Compendium |publisher=Romanian Cultural Institute (Center for Transylvanian Studies) |isbn=978-973-7784-12-4 |page=308}} * 8,000 WallachiansPetre P. Panaintescu, [http://www.scribd.com/doc/45864236/Panaitescu-Mihai-Viteazul ''Mihai Viteazul''] * 3,000 Moldavians * 1,500 mercenaries sent by [[Maximilian III, Archduke of Austria]] * artillery and 300 knights from [[Grand Duchy of Tuscany|Tuscany]] (under [[Silvio Piccolomini]]){{cite book|title=Istoria Românilor: De la mijlocul secolului al XIV-lea pînă la începutul secolului al XVII lea|author1=Giurescu, C.C.|author2=Giurescu, D.C.|date=1976|publisher=Editura științifică|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=M0VJAQAAIAAJ|accessdate=2014-11-26}}{{cite web|url=http://www.scribd.com/doc/45864236/Panaitescu-Mihai-Viteazul|title=Panaitescu-Mihai_Viteazul|work=scribd.com|accessdate=23 May 2015}} |strength2= Unknown |casualties1= |casualties2= }} {{Campaignbox Long War (Ottoman wars)}} The '''Battle of Giurgiu''' took place on 27–30 October 1595.George Marcu (coord.), Enciclopedia bătăliilor din istoria românilor, Editura Meronia, Bucureşti, 2011 It was one battle of the [[Long War (Ottoman wars)|Long War]], from 1591 or 1593 to 1606, the border conflict between the [[Habsburg Monarchy]] and the [[Ottoman Empire]] over Balkan territories.{{cite book | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=oBHJ1eK_tcoC&pg=PA846 | title = The age of wars of religion, 1000-1650: an encyclopedia of global warfare and civilization | author = Cathal J. Nolan | publisher = Greenwood Publishing Group | year = 2006 | page = 846 | accessdate = 2012-03-23}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Ottoman battles}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Giurgiu, Battle of}} [[Category:Battles involving the Ottoman Empire]] [[Category:Conflicts in 1595|Battle of Giurgiu]] [[Category:Battles involving Wallachia]] [[Category:16th century in the Ottoman Empire]] [[Category:1595 in Europe]] [[Category:Long Turkish War]]
